page.title: 05COBERLEY PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: The village has got smaller over the years but not in size. Many people used to work on the farms but machinery (tractors, etc) has taken over. Many young couples came to live for the quiet life in Coberley but found it difficult to adjust so left. The village is very quiet and secluded not as it used to be. Now the congregation at the village church is about fifty, a good number, but only five or six are from the village. Now people are not occupied with farms but work in Cheltenham, that is those who are not retired and live off their pensions and allowances. The village school has been there for many years. There thirty pupils most of them coming from outside the village. All the old people in the village attended the school whereas now some children go into Cheltenham.
